parameters.name: DefaultSubscription_Internal
parameters.query:
where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| take 1
| project subscriptionId

parameters.name: Subscription
parameters.query:
summarize by subscriptionId
| project value = strcat("/subscriptions/", subscriptionId), label = subscriptionId, selected = iff(subscriptionId =~ '{DefaultSubscription_Internal}', true, false)

parameters.name: Workspace
parameters.query:
where type =~ "microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces"
| where '{Subscription}' has subscriptionId

parameters.name: SIEM
parameters.query:
let SIEMs = datatable(Vendor: string) ["Splunk", "QRadar", "ArcSight"];
SIEMs

parameters.name: InternalRG
parameters.query:
where type =~ "microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces"
| where id =~  "{Workspace}"
| project resourceGroup

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.query:
summarize by subscriptionId
| project value = strcat("/subscriptions/", subscriptionId), label = subscriptionId, selected = iff(subscriptionId =~ '{DefaultSubscription_Internal}', true, false)
| project label

parameters.name: CompletionScore
parameters.query:
_GetWatchlist('Deployment')
| summarize Score = (100/count())*countif(Status has 'Completed')

parameters.name: WatchlistCount
parameters.query:
_GetWatchlist('Deployment')
| project Priority, Category, Action, Status, LastUpdate, Blocked, CompletionDate
| sort by Priority asc
| summarize count()

content.json:
### General Tips

Migrating between SIEMs can be broken down to 4 main phases:
- Discovery
- Design
- Implementation
- Operationalize

For a deeper break down of each phase, please refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration
For a quick comparison between SIEM vendor terminology, please refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-security-operations-center-processes#compare-siem-concepts
For insights on deploying side-by-side, please refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/deploy-side-by-side

### Instructions

Note: Confirm that the correct subscription and workspace are set at the top of the page. 

This section is meant to view and update the goal tracking for the deployment. To do so:
1. Make sure that the goal tracking Watchlist has been deployed. </br>
	a. If the Watchlist has not been deployed, please check the Microsoft GitHub repository for the template under MigrationandDeployment. https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/tree/master/Watchlists/DeploymentandMigration </br>
	b. If it is not deployed, click the 'Deploy to Azure' button and complete the process to deploy. Instructions can be found in the readme file in GitHub.
2. Click the 'Edit Deployment Watchlist' button in order to pivot to the Watchlist editor. </br>
3. Make the changes as needed. </br>
4. Click save. </br>
5. Refresh the workbook to reflect the changes. It may take a minute.

If filtering by priority is preferred, click on the Priority slider to change the view.
# Your current deployment score is {CompletionScore} out of 100

content.query:
_GetWatchlist('Deployment')
| project Priority, Category, Action, Status, LastUpdate, Blocked, CompletionDate
| sort by Priority asc

_GetWatchlist('Deployment')
| project Priority, Category, Action, Status, LastUpdate, Blocked, CompletionDate
| sort by Priority asc

_GetWatchlist('Deployment')
| extend StartDate = datetime(01/15/2022 00:00:00)
| where LastUpdatedTimeUTC between(StartDate .. now())
| summarize count() by Action, bin(todatetime(CompletionDate), 1d)

content.json: ### Please note that any deployment performed in this section will apply to the current Microsoft Sentinel instance, it will not apply to a different instance or workspace chosen above.

### General Best Practices for Migrating Data

For general recommended practices, please refer to this document on migrating to Microsoft Sentinel: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration#migrate-your-data

### Splunk *Streaming*

If looking to continuously stream data from Splunk to Microsoft Sentinel, consider using the Splunk app for Microsoft Sentinel: https://splunkbase.splunk.com/app/5312/

*Collector Based*

If collecting data via collectors, migrating those pipelines to Microsoft Sentinel is as simple as deploying and configuring either the Microsoft Monitoring Agent or the Azure Monitoring Agent. Please refer to the following documents:
For Windows Event: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/agents/log-analytics-agent, https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/data-connectors-reference#windows-security-events-via-ama
For Syslog/CEF: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/connect-syslog, https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/connect-common-event-format

*API Based*

If collecting API based data sources, Microsoft Sentinel supports API collection via built-in connectors or custom methods. Please refer to the documents below:
Data Collection Endpoints: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/data-collection-endpoint-overview
Data Collector API: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/data-collector-api

### General Best Practices for Migrating Data

For general recommended practices, please refer to this document on migrating to Microsoft Sentinel: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration#migrate-your-data

### QRadar *Collector Based*

If collecting data via collectors, migrating those pipelines to Microsoft Sentinel is as simple as deploying and configuring either the Microsoft Monitoring Agent or the Azure Monitoring Agent. Please refer to the following documents:
For Windows Event: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/agents/log-analytics-agent, https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/data-connectors-reference#windows-security-events-via-ama
For Syslog/CEF: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/connect-syslog, https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/connect-common-event-format

*API Based*

If collecting API based data sources, Microsoft Sentinel supports API collection via built-in connectors or custom methods. Please refer to the documents below:
Data Collection Endpoints: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/data-collection-endpoint-overview
Data Collector API: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/data-collector-api

### General Best Practices for Migrating Data

For general recommended practices, please refer to this document on migrating to Microsoft Sentinel: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration#migrate-your-data

### ArcSight *Collector Based*

If collecting data via collectors, migrating those pipelines to Microsoft Sentinel is as simple as deploying and configuring either the Microsoft Monitoring Agent or the Azure Monitoring Agent. Please refer to the following documents:
For Windows Event: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/agents/log-analytics-agent, https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/data-connectors-reference#windows-security-events-via-ama
For Syslog/CEF: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/connect-syslog, https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/connect-common-event-format

*API Based*

If collecting API based data sources, Microsoft Sentinel supports API collection via built-in connectors or custom methods. Please refer to the documents below:
Data Collection Endpoints: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/data-collection-endpoint-overview
Data Collector API: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/data-collector-api

### Instructions

The buttons below are programmed to move to the connector pages as needed. To deploy:
1. Click on the button to navigate to the connector page. </br>
2. Once on the connector page, review the steps listed under 'Configuration'. </br>
3. Once performed, data should begin flowing into the workspace. </br>
4. If there are connectors needed that are not listed below, please use the buttons for the connector gallery or Content Hub to deploy the desired connector.

If desired, related workbooks and analytic rules can also be deployed by going to the 'Next Steps' tab.

content.query:
union *
| where TimeGenerated > startofday(ago(31d))
| summarize GBytes = sum(_BilledSize)/(1024*1024*1024) by bin(TimeGenerated, 1d)
content.title: Data Ingestion Over Last {TimeRange}

content.query:
union withsource=TableName1 *
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange:query}
| summarize Entries = count(), Size = sum(_BilledSize), last_log = datetime_diff("second",now(), max(TimeGenerated)), estimate  = sumif(_BilledSize, _IsBillable==true)  by TableName1, _IsBillable
| project ['Table Name'] = TableName1, ['Table Size'] = Size, ['Table Entries'] = Entries,
          ['Size per Entry'] = 1.0 * Size / Entries, ['IsBillable'] = _IsBillable, ['Latest Record Created'] =  last_log //, ['Latest Record Recieved'] =last_ingestion
 | order by ['Table Size']  desc

content.query:
resources
| where "{Subscription:Id}" has subscriptionId or "{Subscription}" == ""
| where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' or type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'MicrosoftMonitoringAgent' or name has 'OmsAgentForLinux' 
| extend Server = extract('(.*)/extensions',1,id)
| extend Subscription = extract('(/subscriptions/.*)/resource.*',1,id)
| extend RG = extract('/resourceGroups/(.*)/providers', 1, id)
| where RG == '{InternalRG}'
| summarize count() by Server, subscriptionId, resourceGroup, Subscription
| project Server, resourceGroup, Subscription
| sort by Server asc
content.title: Azure or Arc Machines with MMA in {InternalRG}

| where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' or type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent' or name has 'AzureMonitorLinuxAgent' 
| extend VM = extract('(/subscriptions.*)/extensions',1,id)
| extend Subscription = extract('(/subscriptions/.*)/resource.*',1,id)
| extend RG = extract('/resourceGroups/(.*)/providers', 1, id)
| where RG == '{InternalRG}'
| summarize count() by VM, subscriptionId, resourceGroup, Subscription
| project VM, resourceGroup, Subscription
| sort by VM asc

content.query:
resources
| where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' or  type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'MicrosoftMonitoringAgent' or name has 'OmsAgentForLinux' or name has 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent' or name has 'AzureMonitorLinuxAgent'
| extend RG = extract('/resourceGroups/(.*)/providers', 1, id)
| where RG == '{InternalRG}'
| extend AzureVM = extract('virtualmachines|virtualMachines/(.*)/extensions',1,id), ArcVM = extract('machines/(.*)/extensions',1,id)
| summarize count() by AzureVM=tolower(AzureVM), ArcVM=tolower(ArcVM), subscriptionId, resourceGroup 
| extend hasBoth = iff(count_ > 1, 'Yes', 'No') | where count_ > 1 
| join (resources | where type has 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions' or type has 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'
| where name has 'MicrosoftMonitoringAgent' or name has 'OmsAgentForLinux' 
| extend AzureVM = extract('virtualmachines|virtualMachines/(.*)/extensions',1,id)) on AzureVM  
| project AzureVM, ArcVM, resourceGroup, MMAVersion=name, hasBoth

content.json:
### Splunk *General Tips and Guidance*

- Evaluate and document most important rules
- Review built-in templates and confirm if templates exist for most important rules
- Identify rules that are lower priority or have not generated alerts in last 6 - 12 months
[Migrate to Microsoft Sentinel from a SIEM](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration#migrate-analytics-rules)

*Translating Existing Rules*

If there are not templates available for essential rules, consider translating the SPL to KQL. Please see the following resources for assistance: [SPL to KQL Mapping](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/master/Tools/RuleMigration/SPL to KQL.md)
https://uncoder.io/
Looking for help on KQL? Deploy the **Intro to KQL workbook** or the **Advanced KQL for Microsoft Sentinel workbook** on the Workbooks tab. For the full document, please refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-splunk-detection-rules
For tips on analyst workflow, please refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-security-operations-center-processes
For insights on deploying side-by-side, please refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/deploy-side-by-side

### QRadar *General Tips and Guidance*

- Evaluate and document most important rules
- Review built-in templates and confirm if templates exist for most important rules
- Identify rules that are lower priority or have not generated alerts in last 6 - 12 months
[Migrate to Microsoft Sentinel from a SIEM](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration#migrate-analytics-rules)

*Translating Existing Rules*

If there are not templates available for essential rules, consider translating the QRadar to Microsoft Sentinel. Please see the following resources for assistance: [QRadar to KQL Mapping](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/master/Tools/RuleMigration/Rule%20Logic%20Mappings.md#qradar)

For insights on deploying side-by-side, please refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/deploy-side-by-side

- Review built-in templates and confirm if templates exist for most important rules

*Translating Existing Rules*

If there are not templates available for essential rules, consider translating ArcSight detections to Microsoft Sentinel. Please see the following resources for assistance: [ArcSight to KQL Mapping](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/master/Tools/RuleMigration/Rule%20Logic%20Mappings.md#arcsight)

content.json:
### Instructions

The section below lists the volume of incidents that have been generated and by whom. Use this section to monitor SOC operations and culprits for alerts/incidents.

content.query:
SecurityAlert
| extend Source = case(ProviderName has 'ASI Scheduled Alerts', 'Microsoft Sentinel',
                    ProviderName has 'MDATP', 'Defender for Endpoint',
                    ProviderName has 'Azure Security Center', 'Defender for Cloud',
                    ProviderName has 'Azure Advanced Threat Protection', 'Defender for Identity',
                    ProviderName has 'OATP', 'Defender for Office',
                    ProviderName has 'MCAS', 'Defender for Cloud Apps',
                    ProviderName)
| summarize count() by Source, bin(TimeGenerated, 1d)
content.title: Incident Frequency by Product

content.query:
SecurityAlert
| extend Source = case(ProviderName has 'ASI Scheduled Alerts', 'Microsoft Sentinel',
                    ProviderName has 'MDATP', 'Defender for Endpoint',
                    ProviderName has 'Azure Security Center', 'Defender for Cloud',
                    ProviderName has 'Azure Advanced Threat Protection', 'Defender for Identity',
                    ProviderName has 'OATP', 'Defender for Office',
                    ProviderName has 'MCAS', 'Defender for Cloud Apps',
                    ProviderName)
| summarize Count = count() by DisplayName, Source
| order by Count desc
content.title: Number of Alerts Raised by Product

content.query:
SecurityIncident
| where Status == 'Closed'
| extend Owner = todynamic(Owner.assignedTo) 
| extend Product = todynamic((parse_json(tostring(AdditionalData.alertProductNames))[0])) 
| extend feedback =strcat(Classification," ",ClassificationReason)
| summarize dcount(IncidentNumber) by feedback
content.title: Incidents Closed with Classification

content.query:
SecurityIncident 
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,Status, Severity, Owner, AdditionalData) by IncidentNumber
| extend Owner = todynamic(Owner.assignedTo) 
| extend Product = todynamic((parse_json(tostring(AdditionalData.alertProductNames))[0])) 
| summarize dcount(IncidentNumber) by Severity
content.title: Incidents created by severity

content.query:
let SecurityProducts = datatable(ProviderName:string, Product:string, Portal:string)
[
    "ASI Scheduled Alerts", "Microsoft Sentinel", "https://portal.azure.com/#blade/HubsExtension/BrowseResource/resourceType/microsoft.securityinsightsarg%2Fsentinel",
    "MCAS", "Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps", "https://portal.cloudappsecurity.com/#/policy",
    "MDATP", "Microsoft Defender for Endpoint", "https://security.microsoft.com/alertpolicies",
    "Azure Security Center", "Microsoft Defender for Cloud", "https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Security/SecurityMenuBlade/7",
    "Detection-WarmPathV2", "Microsoft Defender for Cloud", "https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Security/SecurityMenuBlade/7",
    "MicrosoftThreatProtection", "Microsoft 365 Defender", "https://security.microsoft.com/alertpolicies",
    "IPC", "Azure Active Directory Identity Protection", "https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_AAD_IAM/IdentityProtectionMenuBlade/UsersAtRiskAlerts",
   "Detection-Fusion", "Machine Learning Fusion Alert", "https://portal.azure.com/#blade/HubsExtension/BrowseResource/resourceType/microsoft.securityinsightsarg%2Fsentinel",
    "Sentinel Fusion", "Machine Learning Fusion Alert", "https://portal.azure.com/#blade/HubsExtension/BrowseResource/resourceType/microsoft.securityinsightsarg%2Fsentinel",
    "Azure Advanced Threat Protection", "Microsoft Defender for Identity", "https://portal.atp.azure.com/",
    "Threat Intelligence Alerts", "Threat Intelligence", "https://portal.azure.com/#blade/HubsExtension/BrowseResource/resourceType/microsoft.securityinsightsarg%2Fsentinel",
    "IoTSecurity", "Microsoft Defender for IoT", "https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_IoT_Defender/IoTDefenderDashboard/Alerts",
    "MSTIC", "Microsoft Intelligent Security Graph", "https://portal.azure.com/#blade/HubsExtension/ArgQueryBlade",
    "AntimalwarePublisher", "Microsoft Anti-Malware", "https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Security/SecurityMenuBlade/7",
    "OATP", "Microsoft Defender for Office 365", "https://security.microsoft.com/alertpolicies",
    "AdaptiveNetworkHardenings", "Microsoft Defender for Cloud", "https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Security/GenericRecommendationDetailsBlade/assessmentKey/f9f0eed0-f143-47bf-b856-671ea2eeed62",
    "StorageThreatDetection", "Azure Defender for Storage", "https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Security/SecurityMenuBlade/7",
    "CloudNetworkSecurity", "Azure Network Security", "https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Network/NetworkWatcherMenuBlade/overview",
    "SQLThreatDetection", "Azure Defender for SQL", "https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Security/SqlVaServersRecommendationDetailsBlade/assessmentKey/82e20e14-edc5-4373-bfc4-f13121257c37"
];
SecurityIncident
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IncidentNumber
| where Status=="Closed"
| mv-expand AlertIds
| extend SystemAlertId=strcat(AlertIds)
| join kind=inner (SecurityAlert | extend SystemAlertId=strcat(SystemAlertId)) on SystemAlertId
| summarize
    TruePositive=countif(Classification == "TruePositive"),
    BenignPositive=countif(Classification == "BenignPositive"),
    FalsePositive=countif(Classification == "FalsePositive"),
    Undetermined=countif(Classification == "Undetermined"),
    Total=countif(Classification == "TruePositive" or Classification == "BenignPositive" or Classification == "FalsePositive") by AlertName, ProviderName1
| extend EfficiencyRating= (TruePositive / todouble(Total)) * 100
| join kind=inner(SecurityProducts) on $left.ProviderName1 == $right.ProviderName
| project AlertName, EfficiencyRating, Portal, Product, Total, TruePositive, BenignPositive, FalsePositive, Undetermined
| sort by EfficiencyRating, Total desc
content.title: Security Alert Efficiency
content.noDataMessage: No Alerts Observed Within These Thresholds

content.json:
### Instructions

This graph lists the number of:
- Runs for scheduled rules
- Runs for NRT rules
- Failures for rules

This information can be used to track:
- How many times rules are running
- How many times rules are failing

Details around the rules can be used in correlation with the volume of alerts/incidents being generated by Microsoft Sentinel. If the volume is too much, the logs and graph can help pinpoint when it's occurring and which rules are responsible for generating the incidents.

content.query:
SentinelHealth
| where SentinelResourceType has 'analytics rule'
| summarize count() by OperationName, bin (TimeGenerated, 1d)
content.title: Analytic Rule Triggering and Failures {TimeRange}

content.query:
SentinelHealth
| where SentinelResourceType has 'analytics rule'
| project TimeGenerated, OperationName, Status, SentinelResourceName, Description, Reason, SentinelResourceKind
| order by TimeGenerated desc
content.title: Analytics Health Logs

content.json: ## If there is a workbook that is of interest that is not listed above, please refer to the Workbook Gallery or Content Hub.

*General Best Practices* </br>

- Identify key automation required for operations </br>
- Review out-of-the-box templates for existing coverage </br>
- Recreate automation by using out-of-the-box actions in Playbooks
- Review manual processes that can be transformed by using SOAR

For more information and mappings between platforms, please refer to *DOCUMENT LINK HERE WHEN GA* </br>

*Considerations Post-Migration* </br>
- Test the automation to confirm that it works. </br>
- Periodically review the automations over time to review if new actions are available to make the automation more efficient or strong. </br>
- Monitor automation performance and health using the Playbook Health Workbook. </br>
- Utilize managed identities and service principals to authenticate within the automation. Azure Key Vault can be utilized to store any sercret needed for automation. For more information, see [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/logic-apps/create-managed-service-identity?tabs=consumption) </br>

*SIEM Based Guidance* </br>

For more information on migrating automation from Splunk, please refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-splunk-automation</br>
For more information on migrating automation from QRadar, please refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-qradar-automation</br>
For more information on migrating automation from ArcSight, please refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-arcsight-automation</br>

For insights on deploying side-by-side, please refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/deploy-side-by-side

### Instructions

This tab lists the deployed playbooks within the resource group as well as which automation rules are deployed and have connected playbooks. 

To review playbook health:
1. Make sure that the Playbook Health workbook is deployed.
2. Click on the 'Check Playbook Health' button.
3. When the context pane opens, click on Workbook.
4. The workbook will be displayed for usage.

To review or deploy new automation resources:
1. Click on the 'Deploy Automation Resources' button to open the Automation blade.
2. Navigate the different tabs to review or deploy automation resources as needed.

Recommended: Look at the Playbooks Gallery to find out-of-the-box templates that are available.

| where resourceGroup == '{InternalRG}'
| extend Name = name
| project Name, ResourceGroup = resourceGroup, Link = id
| sort by Name asc

content.json: ### Please note that any deployment performed in this section will apply to the current Microsoft Sentinel instance, it will not apply to a different instance or workspace chosen above.

### Instructions

This tab lists buttons for managing entity pages as well as a quick glimpse at entity behavior related tables. 

To configure UEBA: 
1. Click on the 'Enable UEBA' button.
2. A context pane will open, click the toggle to 'On'.
3. Select the data sources that should be used for the entity pages.
4. Click save.

To customize entity timelines:
1. Click the 'Customize Entity Timeline'.
2. Select a template of interest and go through the deployment wizard.
3. If looking to create custom events, click 'add activity' and complete the wizard process.

## If tables are listed as false:

- Make sure that the right data sources are enabled that are required for the tables to be ingested.
- Review when UEBA was enabled as certain enrichment tables require a few days to generate data.
- Make sure the time range is set to a higher number. Some tables generate insights on a schedule which may have not been included in a smaller time range.

For the IdentityInfo table:
- Changes made to your user profiles in Azure AD are updated in the IdentityInfo table within 15 minutes.
- Group and role information is synchronized between the IdentityInfo table and Azure AD daily.
- Every 21 days, Microsoft Sentinel re-synchronizes with your entire Azure AD to ensure that stale records are fully updated.
- Default retention time in the IdentityInfo table is 30 days.

### Looking to Migrate Splunk Data?

General Information:
- [Select a Target Azure Platform to Host Exported Historical Data](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-ingestion-target-platform) - [Consider Using a Data Ingestion Tool](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-ingestion-tool) - [Ingest Historical Data into Target Azure Platform](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-export-ingest) *Items to Consider:*
- Usage and value of migrated data
- Speed of migrating data
- Available tooling to assist
To export Splunk data, use one of the [Splunk export options](https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.2.5/Search/Exportsearchresults)
*CLI Example*
This CLI command exports data recorded between 23:59 and 01:00 on September 14, 2021 to a CSV file: splunk search "index=_internal earliest=09/14/2021:23:59:00 latest=09/16/2021:01:00:00 " -output csv > c:/data.csv *Log Dump Example*
This dump command exports data recorded on the specified date to a CSV file: index=bigdata | eval _dstpath=strftime(_time, "%Y%m%d/%H") + "/" + host | dump basefilename=MyExport format=csv For the full document, please refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-splunk-historical-data

### Looking to Migrate QRadar Data?

General Information:
- [Select a Target Azure Platform to Host Exported Historical Data](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-ingestion-target-platform) - [Consider Using a Data Ingestion Tool](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-ingestion-tool) - [Ingest Historical Data into Target Azure Platform](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-export-ingest) *Items to Consider:*
- Usage and value of migrated data
- Speed of migrating data
- Available tooling to assist
Follow the steps in these sections to export your historical data to Microsoft Sentinel with [QRadar forwarding destination](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/qsip/7.5?topic=administration-forward-data-other-systems)
*Configure QRadar Forwarding Destination*
Configure the QRadar forwarding destination, including your profile, rules, and destination address: 1. [Configure a forwarding profile](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/qsip/7.5?topic=systems-configuring-forwarding-profiles) 2. [Add a forwarding destination](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/qsip/7.5?topic=systems-adding-forwarding-destinations):
a. Set the Event Format to JSON.
b. Set the Destination Address to a server that has syslog running on TCP port 5141 and stores the ingested logs to a local folder path.
c. Select the forwarding profile created in step 1.
d. Enable the forwarding destination configuration.
*Configure Routing Rules*
1. [Configure routing rules to forward data](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/qsip/7.5?topic=systems-configuring-routing-rules-forward-data) 2. Set the Mode to Offline. 3. Select the relevant Forwarding Event Processor. 4. Set the Data Source to Events. 5. Select Add Filter to add filter criteria for data that needs to be exported. For example, use the Log Source Time field to set a timestamp range. 6. Select Forward and select the forwarding destination created when you [configured the QRadar forwarding destination in step 2](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-qradar-historical-data?#configure-qradar-forwarding-destination) 7. [Enable the routing rule configuration](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/qsip/7.5?topic=systems-viewing-managing-routing-rules) 8. Repeat steps 1-7 for each event processor from which you need to export data. For the full document, please refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-qradar-historical-data

### Looking to Migrate ArcSight Data?

General Information:
- [Select a Target Azure Platform to Host Exported Historical Data](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-ingestion-target-platform) - [Consider Using a Data Ingestion Tool](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-ingestion-tool) - [Ingest Historical Data into Target Azure Platform](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-export-ingest) *Items to Consider:*
- Usage and value of migrated data
- Speed of migrating data
- Available tooling to assist
*Event Data Transfer Tool*

To flexibly combine your analysis with unstructured data, in addition to the structured CEF data, use Enterprise Security Manager (ESM) events. The Event Data Transfer Tool exports ESM events in three formats: CEF, CSV, and key-value pairs. To export your data with the Event Data Transfer Tool: 1. [Install and configure the Event Transfer Tool](https://www.microfocus.com/documentation/arcsight/arcsight-esm-7.6/ESM_AdminGuide/#ESM_AdminGuide/EventDataTransfer/EventDataTransfer.htm)
2. Configure the logs export to use a CSV format. For example, this command exports data recorded between 15:45 and 16:45 on May 4, 2016 to a CSV file: arcsight event_transfer -dtype File -dpath <***path***> -format csv -start "05/04/2016 15:45:00" -end "05/04/2016 16:45:00" *Lacat Utility*
Use this tool for any volume of data smaller than than a TB. lacat is a simple utility that exports CEF records from a logger archive file, and prints them the records to stdout by design. You can then redirect the records to a file or pipe them for further manipulation, such as grep, awk, and so on. To export data with the lacat utility: 1. [Download the lacat utility](https://github.com/hpsec/lacat)
2. [Follow the examples in the lacat repository on how to run the script](https://github.com/hpsec/lacat) For the full document, please refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/migration-arcsight-historical-data

### Instructions

This tab lists tables within the workspace and their current configuration for retention and archive. 

To configure archive:
1. Click on one one of the tables.
2. A section will appear below, within the box provided enter the desired total retention for the table. </br>
	Note: Archive retention is found by taking TotalRetention and subtracting WorkspaceRetention. So if a table is set to 400 days of total retention and the workspace is only 90 days, the archive retention will be 310 days.
3. Once the total retention is ready, click 'Update Retention'. 
4. A context pane will appear to confirm the changes to be made. If all is set, click 'Update Retention' again.
5. To see the changes, refresh the workbook and view the table again.

tooltipFormat.tooltip: Microsoft Sentinel provides 90 days of data retention for free
You can control your costs by applying a cap to the amount of data that you collect per day

content.json:
**Basic Logs**

There are two supported plan types, Analytics and Basic. All tables in your Log Analytics are Analytics tables, by default. 

You can configure particular tables to use **Basic Logs** at reduced priced that have the following limitations:
- Table retention fixed at 8 days
- Alerts are not supported
- Limited KQL language support

You can currently configure the following tables for Basic Logs:

- All tables created with the Data Collection Rule (DCR)-based custom logs API.
- ContainerLog and ContainerLogV2, which Container Insights uses and which include verbose text-based log records.
- AppTraces, which contains freeform log records for application traces in Application Insights.

[More Information on Basic Logs](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/log-analytics-workspace-overview?WT.mc_id=modinfra-0000-rotrent#log-data-plans-preview)

[Which tables support Basic Logs?](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/basic-logs-configure?tabs=api-1%2Cportal-1#which-tables-support-basic-logs)

[Sending Custom Logs](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/custom-logs-overview)

**Data Retention and Archive**

Data in each table in a Log Analytics workspace is retained for a specified period of time after which it's either removed or archived with a reduced retention fee. 

- Set the retention time to balance your requirement for having data available with reducing your cost for data retention.

[More Information on Data retention and archive](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/data-retention-archive)

**Search and Restore**

This tab shows current Search and Restore Tables. For more information on Search and Restore please refer to:

[Search across long time spans in large datasets](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/search-jobs)

[Restore archived logs from search](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/restore)

You may receive a "Could not find column 'TableName' in table 'TableRetentionQuery'" error below, indicating your workspace doesn't currently have any tables that support Basic Plans. 

For more information on what tables support Basic Logs please refer to:

[Which tables support Basic Logs?](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/basic-logs-configure?tabs=api-1%2Cportal-1#which-tables-support-basic-logs)

content.json: You are about to modify the settings of the **{TableName}** table to enable **Archive Logs**. This will modify the **{TableName}** table with a different retention period from the default workspace retntion period of {workspaceRetention} days up to 7 years (2,555 days) > **Note:** Tables will inherit the retention of workspace unless changed. - If a retention is set on a table and the workspace retention is changed, the table retention will not be affected. - To **reset** the table retention to the workspace retention, select the **Reset Retention** button - You can access archived data by running a **search job** or **restoring archived logs** - You can set the workspace default retention policy in the Azure portal to 30, 31, 60, 90, 120, 180, 270, 365, 550, and 730 days.

parameters.name: totalRetentionInDays
parameters.label: Total Retention in Days
parameters.description: The table's total data retention including archive period. Set this property to null if you don't want to archive data.
